alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"Unfortunately -- and that seems to be a universal phenomenon -- what is gained in unity is generally lost in terms of intuitive vision of things ... Atoms themselves are composed of neutrons, protons, and electrons. Beyond this point, one descends into the depths of matter with the standard model and its quarks. Is there an even deeper level? Is there something to be gained by looking for it?"
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Discoveries Occur Typically By Way of Unifying Syntheses - Part 2
